API](https://github.com/angular/components/commit/9f1989228f10694b61e694db456c387687e9626d "feat(google-maps): add support for dynamic library loading API Currently the `@angular/google-maps` module is implemented on top of the legacy ` ``` **Note:** the component also supports loading the API using the [legacy script tag](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/load-maps-js-api#use-legacy-tag), however it isn't recommended because it requires all of the Google Maps JavaScript to be loaded up-front, even if it isn't used. ## Components [Permalink: Components](https://github.com/angular/components/tree/main/src/google-maps#components) - [`GoogleMap`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/google-map/README.md) - [`MapMarker`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-marker/README.md) - [`MapInfoWindow`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-info-window/README.md) - [`MapPolyline`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-polyline/README.md) - [`MapPolygon`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-polygon/README.md) - [`MapRectangle`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-rectangle/README.md) - [`MapCircle`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-circle/README.md) - [`MapGroundOverlay`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-ground-overlay/README.md) - [`MapKmlLayer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-kml-layer/README.md) - [`MapTrafficLayer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-traffic-layer/README.md) - [`MapTransitLayer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-transit-layer/README.md) - [`MapBicyclingLayer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-bicycling-layer/README.md) - [`MapDirectionsRenderer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-directions-renderer/README.md) - [`MapHeatmapLayer`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-heatmap-layer/README.md) ## Services [Permalink: Services](https://github.com/angular/components/tree/main/src/google-maps#services) - [`MapGeocoder`](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/map-geocoder/README.md) ## The Options Input [Permalink: The Options Input](https://github.com/angular/components/tree/main/src/google-maps#the-options-input) The Google Maps components implement all of the options for their respective objects from the Google Maps JavaScript API through an `options` input, but they also have specific inputs for some of the most common options. For example, the Google Maps component could have its options set either in with a google.maps.MapOptions object: ``` ``` ``` options: google.maps.MapOptions = { center: {lat: 40, lng: -20}, zoom: 4 }; ``` It can also have individual options set for some of the most common options: ``` ``` ``` center: google.maps.LatLngLiteral = {lat: 40, lng: -20}; zoom = 4; ``` Not every option has its own input. See the API for each component to see if the option has a dedicated input or if it should be set in the options input. You can’t perform that action at this time.
